markdown:
٨ في الشكل المقابل تكون نسبة الضغط عند المكبس الكبير إلى الضغط عند المكبس الصغير .........

( الساحل / القاهرة ٣٣ )

أ  $\frac{1}{2}$
ب  $\frac{1}{1}$
ج  $\frac{2}{1}$
د  لا يمكن تحديدها <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.355,t=0.065,r=0.930,b=0.188), with ID 14be7b43-ee34-40a8-a48e-8988a7aab9cc -->

Summary : This illustration shows a U-shaped tube filled with liquid, with two pistons of different areas placed on each side, demonstrating the principle of hydraulic force multiplication.

illustration:
Scene Overview :
  • The left side of the U-tube has a wide cylinder with cross-sectional area labeled "2A" and a piston on top.
  • The right side has a narrower cylinder with area "A" and a piston on top.
  • The liquid level is higher on the left side than on the right.
  • An upward force "F" is applied to the larger piston (left), and a downward force "f" is applied to the smaller piston (right).

Technical Details :
  • The left piston has area "2A" and the right piston has area "A".
  • The forces are labeled: "F" (upward) on the left piston, "f" (downward) on the right piston.
  • The pistons are shown as brown disks fitting tightly in the cylinders.
  • The liquid is colored blue, filling the U-tube.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The left cylinder is wider and contains more liquid above the piston than the right.
  • The pistons are at different heights, with the left piston higher than the right.
  • The U-tube connects the two cylinders at the bottom, allowing pressure transmission.

Analysis :
  • The figure visually demonstrates Pascal's principle: a force applied to a confined fluid is transmitted undiminished throughout the fluid.
  • The difference in piston areas suggests that a smaller force "f" on the right can balance a larger force "F" on the left, illustrating mechanical advantage in hydraulic systems. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.076,t=0.058,r=0.315,b=0.187), with ID 48542c0f-1c46-4310-b1c5-85cb86040175 -->

Summary : This figure presents four candidate graphs, each showing a possible relationship between the displacement of a large hydraulic piston (y₂) and the displacement of a small piston (y₁), with both axes labeled and the same scale used for both quantities.

line plots:
Title & Axes :
  • No explicit title on the plots, but the context is the relationship between y₂ (large piston displacement) and y₁ (small piston displacement).
  • X-axis labeled y₁ (displacement of small piston).
  • Y-axis labeled y₂ (displacement of large piston).
  • No tick labels or numeric values; axes are schematic.

Candidate Graphs :
  • (د) — Curve starts high on y₂-axis and decreases rapidly as y₁ increases (downward-sloping, concave curve).
  • (ذ) — Straight line with positive slope, starting from the origin (y₂ increases linearly with y₁).
  • (ب) — Straight line with positive slope, steeper than (ذ), starting from the origin.
  • (أ) — Straight line with positive slope, less steep than (ذ), starting from the origin.

Design Encodings :
  • All graphs use blue axes and a red curve or line for the relationship.
  • Each graph is labeled with an Arabic letter in a circle: د, ذ, ب, أ (right to left).

Analysis :
  • Three of the graphs (ذ, ب, أ) show linear relationships with different slopes, while (د) shows a nonlinear, inverse relationship.
  • The figure is designed to test understanding of the physical relationship between piston displacements in a hydraulic system, with the correct answer likely being the inverse relationship (د), as expected from the principle of hydraulic multiplication (constant volume: y₁A₁ = y₂A₂). <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.069,t=0.197,r=0.927,b=0.384), with ID e5a21602-782d-443f-a554-61f2543beacd -->

١٠ إذا كانت النسبة بين قطري مكبسي المكبس الهيدروليكي هي $\frac{٥}{١}$، فإن نسبة الضغط عند المكبس الصغير إلى الضغط الناتج عند المكبس الكبير في حالة اتزان المكبسين في مستوى أفقي واحد هي ........  
(أ) $\frac{١}{٥}$  
(ب) $\frac{٥}{١}$  
(ج) $\frac{١}{١}$  
(د) $\frac{٢٥}{١}$ <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.073,t=0.390,r=0.929,b=0.479), with ID cb8f9062-d7ba-450f-a75a-8b7de862729f -->

١١ إذا كانت النسبة بين نصفى قطرى أسطوانتى المكبس الهيدروليكى $\frac{5}{2}$، فإن الفائدة الآلية للمكبس تساوى ........

( أ ) $\frac{5}{2}$  ( ب ) $\frac{25}{4}$  ( ج ) $\frac{2}{5}$  ( د ) $\frac{4}{25}$

( كفر الدوار / البحيرة ٢٤ ) <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.075,t=0.483,r=0.928,b=0.552), with ID 9a7c5172-bb1c-4a01-888b-df58123f798e -->

١٢ إذا كانت الفائدة الآلية لكبس هيدروليكي تساوي ٢٥٠ ومساحة المكبس الصغير ٢.٥ cm² فإن نصف قطر المكبس الكبير يساوي ........

١٤.١ cm ⓘ      ١٠٠ cm ⓞ      ١٩٨.٨١ cm ⓞ      ٦٢٥ cm ⓞ

(أزمنت / الأقصر ٢٤) <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.072,t=0.555,r=0.929,b=0.639), with ID 7e00cab0-e856-4cb5-af91-53e2619805d3 -->

Summary : This is a physics illustration showing a hydraulic press system with two pistons of different areas, a liquid of density ρ, and a mass m placed on the larger piston. The diagram is accompanied by a multiple-choice question in Arabic, asking for the value of the mass m in terms of ρ, h, and A.

illustration:
  Scene Overview :
    • The diagram shows a U-shaped hydraulic press filled with liquid.
    • The left side has a small piston with area A and a height difference h above the liquid.
    • The right side has a larger piston with area 3A, on which a mass m is placed.
    • The liquid level is higher on the left side by a vertical distance h.
    • The system is labeled with variables: h (height difference), y (reference level), m (mass), A (area), 3A (area).
    • The system is in static equilibrium.
  Technical Details :
    • No scale bar or units are shown.
    • The pistons are labeled with their respective areas.
    • The mass m is shown as a black object on the larger piston.
  Spatial Relationships :
    • The left piston (area A) is at a higher liquid level than the right piston (area 3A).
    • The height difference between the two liquid surfaces is labeled h.
    • The mass m is only on the larger piston (right side).
  Question and Choices :
    • The question asks: "A hydraulic press contains a liquid of density ρ and its pistons are in equilibrium as shown, with areas A and 3A. If the mass m is placed on the larger piston, what is the value of m?"
    • Four answer choices are given:
      - m = ρ h A
      - m = 2 ρ h A
      - m = 3 ρ h A
      - m = 4 ρ h A

Analysis :
  • The illustration visually represents Pascal's principle and the pressure balance in a hydraulic press.
  • The height difference h and the area ratio (A to 3A) are key to solving for the mass m.
  • The multiple-choice answers suggest the solution involves multiplying ρ, h, and A by a factor (1, 2, 3, or 4), likely derived from pressure equilibrium. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.073,t=0.644,r=0.927,b=0.780), with ID 8f76c6e4-6f8e-40b1-bfbd-4b3e2aad42a0 -->

Summary : This is a physics illustration and multiple-choice question about a hydraulic press system, showing two pistons of different cross-sectional areas and masses, and asking for the mass M required for equilibrium.

illustration:
Scene Overview :
  • The image shows a U-shaped hydraulic system filled with hydraulic fluid.
  • On the left side, a small piston with cross-sectional area a supports a mass m.
  • On the right side, a larger piston with cross-sectional area 10a supports a mass M.
  • Both pistons are labeled, and the fluid is labeled as "سائل هيدروليكي" (hydraulic fluid).
  • The pistons are shown at the same horizontal level, indicating equilibrium.

Technical Details :
  • The left piston is labeled with mass m.
  • The right piston is labeled with mass M.
  • The cross-sectional area of the left piston is a; the right piston is 10a.
  • The system is described as being in equilibrium, neglecting the mass of the pistons themselves.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The two pistons are at opposite ends of the U-tube, with the hydraulic fluid connecting them.
  • Both pistons are at the same vertical height, indicating balanced pressures.

Question and Choices :
  • The question asks: If the small piston carries mass m and the large piston (area 10a) carries mass M, what is the value of M for equilibrium?
  • Four answer choices are provided:
    - (أ) M = m
    - (ب) M = 10 m
    - (ج) M = 100 m
    - (د) M = 150 m

Analysis :
  • The illustration visually represents Pascal's principle in a hydraulic press, where the force applied to the smaller piston is transmitted to the larger piston.
  • The question tests understanding of the relationship between force, area, and pressure in hydraulic systems.
  • The answer choices reflect different possible ratios between the masses, based on the area ratio. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.080,t=0.784,r=0.923,b=0.928), with ID fee49f9c-957d-4bb4-a815-ae65b253d5e7 -->
